com.mostc.host
Class Host

java.lang.Object
  com.mostc.host.Host
Direct Known Subclasses:
LocalHost, RemoteHost
public abstract class Host
extends java.lang.Object

Abstracts host management so client code doesn't need to care if host is local or remote(ssh).

See Also:
exec(java.lang.String, int, java.util.Map, byte[], java.nio.charset.Charset, java.lang.String), cmd(java.lang.String, int), DEV, isRemote(), readFile(java.lang.String), saveText(java.lang.String, java.lang.String), getSystemDrive(), isWindows(), join(java.lang.String...), dirSeparator()

Field Summary
static int DEV
          for development, set DEV > 0 (ex: DEV=1) and it will use PFTT/Dev-N/ instead of PFTT/Current/ and php-sdk/Dev-N instead of php-sdk this allows for running development versions of PFTT on same host as production(Current) version
static int NO_TIMEOUT

          on Windows, certain command line commands aren't actually programs, but rather commands to CMD.exe If this is windows, this will automatically execute the command with CMD.

          Compresses local source into a 7zip file and uploads it and then decompresses it on the remote host This will improve performance for a few large files or a lots of small files.

Field Detail

DEV

public static final int DEV
for development, set DEV > 0 (ex: DEV=1) and it will use PFTT/Dev-N/ instead of PFTT/Current/ and php-sdk/Dev-N instead of php-sdk this allows for running development versions of PFTT on same host as production(Current) version

getOSName

public java.lang.String getOSName()
returns the name of the Host operating system. cleans up the name and returns it in a short standard form with CPU architecture and service pack, for example: Win 7 SP1 x64

Returns:

isRemote

public abstract boolean isRemote()
returns true if this Host refers to a remote host (ex: ssh). returns false for localhost

Returns:

isOpen

public boolean isOpen()
returns true if #close not yet called. if #close called though, most methods will throw an IllegalStateException

Returns:

getContentsDetectCharset

public abstract java.lang.String getContentsDetectCharset(java.lang.String file,
                                                          CharsetDeciderDecoder cdd)
                                                   throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                                                          java.io.IOException
gets the contents of the file as single unicode string, automatically detecting the character set and converting the bytes to a string (supports exotic charsets like EUC-CN or SHIFT_JS). Note: this takes extra time, often most files can be read with just #getContents because they don't use exotic charsets

Parameters:
file -
cdd -
Returns:
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException
java.io.IOException

exec

public abstract ExecOutput exec(java.lang.String cmd,
                                int timeout_sec,
                                java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> object,
                                byte[] stdin_post,
                                java.nio.charset.Charset charset,
                                java.lang.String current_dir)
                         throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                                java.lang.Exception
executes the given program

Parameters:
cmd - - program to run
timeout_sec - - maximum number of seconds program is allowed to run - terminated if it goes over
env - - map of environment variables to use
stdin_post - - bytes to pass to program's STDIN
charset - - character set to assume program's output is - otherwise it'll autodetect it, which is slower
current_dir - - current directory for the program
Returns:
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException
java.lang.Exception
See Also:

cmd

public ExecOutput cmd(java.lang.String cmd,
                      int timeout_sec)
               throws java.lang.Exception
on Windows, certain command line commands aren't actually programs, but rather commands to CMD.exe If this is windows, this will automatically execute the command with CMD. If this is linux, it just passes the command to #exec

Parameters:
cmd -
timeout_sec -
env -
stdin_data -
charset -
Returns:
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException
java.lang.Exception

upload7ZipAndDecompress

public void upload7ZipAndDecompress(java.lang.String src,
                                    java.lang.String dst)
                             throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                                    java.io.IOException,
                                    java.lang.Exception
uploads a 7zip file from local source to remote destination and decompresses it. Assumes local source is already a 7zip file, while #uploadCompressWith7Zip does the compression itself

Parameters:

dst -
